snippet: Vowing that faction leaders will “pay a heavy price,” President Recep Tayyip Erdogan made a dramatic appearance after his supporters flooded the streets of Turkey’s largest city....
abstract: Military coup attempt in Turkey plunges country into night of violence and uncertainty, leaving dozens dead and threatening Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan's hold on power; Erdogan's supporters take to streets to oppose coup, while he himself takes to social media to signal that overthrow attempt is failing.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and CEYLAN YEGINSU
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Safak Timur from Istanbul, Sabrina Tavernise and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Vowing that faction leaders will “pay a heavy price,” President Recep Tayyip Erdogan made a dramatic appearance after his supporters flooded the streets of Turkey’s largest city.

headline.main: Turkish President Returns to Istanbul in Sign Military Coup Is Faltering
headline.print_headline: Turkey Is Battlefield in a Coup Attempt

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
